intro: Mesosphaerum tenellum, commonly known as the slender mesosphaerum, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, and they bloom in clusters. Mesosphaerum tenellum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
